snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio needs to flesh out his vague policies on how and when the city should intervene.
abstract: Editorial contends New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio should use his first major education address as mayor to explain why city is late in submitting state-mandated plans detailing how it will help troubled schools; holds he also needs to address why he does not yet have a credible plan to deal with troubled Boys and Girls High School in Brooklyn; holds if de Blasio fails to deliver, Board of Regents should use its authority to shutter those schools that appear beyond saving.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio needs to flesh out his vague policies on how and when the city should intervene.
